node.title: When fear and misinformation struck this Pacific community, their youth took a stand
node.alt: A close-up of Shenei Panaia with a flower in her hair.
node.description: When vaccine anxiety swept through Australia's diverse communities, local "heroes" were on-call to offer support. Meet the volunteers who helped overcome "panic and anxiety" during COVID-19.
node.content:
["Shenei Meisi Penaia spent her 21st birthday working at a vaccination day dedicated to Melbourne's\u00a0Maori and Pacific Islander communities.\u00a0", "The Australia-born Samoan became a trusted voice during the pandemic, at a time when there was \"overall panic and anxiety\"\u00a0and vaccine hesitancy was high, especially among elders.", "\"A lot of our elders did not have the correct information. There was a lot of misinformation all over the media,\"\u00a0\u00a0Ms Penaia told the ABC.\u00a0", "With large households and high rates of chronic illness, the Pasifika community has been particularly vulnerable\u00a0to COVID-19.", "Community leaders and experts have also raised\u00a0concerns\u00a0that anti-vax\u00a0messaging was being\u00a0targeting at marginalised, diverse groups.", "Ms\u00a0Penaia realised more needed to be done to help her \"village\".", "", "
Ms Penaia says she's priveleged to host\u00a0Talanoa sessions and share\u00a0information that is tailored to be understood by the Pasifika community.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "If the right\u00a0information was going to reach those who needed it the most, it needed to come from\u00a0Pasifika young people, she said.\u00a0", "\"If our young people did not have access to that information \u2014\u00a0the correct information \u2014\u00a0our elders would not get it,\" she said.\u00a0", "Through The Pasifika Navigators, a youth advocacy and advisory group,\u00a0Ms Penaia has been a frontrunner in streamlining COVID-19 information.", "She has been involved in spreading\u00a0culturally targeted and translated messaging through online \"Talanoa\" information sessions aimed at expectant mothers, elders and youths,\u00a0and has been on-site at community vaccination hubs.", "The information sessions have involved\u00a0a collective of doctors, nurses and healthcare professionals all of Pacific Islander heritage.", "\"Having that information coming from our people, you have a little bit more security there and I think that really reassured our elders a lot more,\" \u00a0Ms Penaia said.", "Since more reputable health and vaccination information has become\u00a0available,\u00a0more elders have been stepping up to get a jab.", "\"There's a lot more calm among the community.\"\u00a0", "", "
Pasifika youth have been on-site providing community support during\u00a0in vaccination days exclusive for Maori and Pacific Island people.(Supplied)
", "On Tuesday night, this success\u00a0was\u00a0recognised by the Victorian Premier.", "Ms Penaia received the\u00a0Multicultural Commission's Youth Award in a ceremony that honoured 52 Victorians who have been supporting\u00a0multicultural communities in\u00a0crisis response and pandemic recovery efforts.", "\"It is important we recognise and thank the multicultural heroes in our communities, who make our state such a welcoming place to live,\" Minister for Multicultural Affairs Ros Spence said.", "
Building confidence after public housing lockdown 'trauma'
", "It isn't uncommon for Ms\u00a0Penaia to receive\u00a0calls from friends asking\u00a0her to speak to their family members about vaccines and the pandemic.\u00a0", "Marwo Mohamed Salat has been a similar point of contact for African communities profoundly impacted by COVID in Melbourne's north.", "When the nine public housing\u00a0towers in North Melbourne went into a hard, unexpected lockdown in 2020, her phone lit up with calls for help.", "\"There was no clear communication to residents who are mainly of African and migrant background,\" Ms Salat told the ABC.", "\"No warning that their basic human rights were being\u00a0taken away.\"", "", "
Marwo Salat has worked tirelessly to ensure her community has had access to accurate COVID information and essential needs during lockdowns.\u00a0\u00a0(Supplied)
", "Ms Salat, a member of Melbourne's Somali community, spent countless hours working late into the night arranging culturally\u00a0appropriate food and urgent supplies for hundreds of people locked in the towers.", "In 2021, that momentum didn't slow\u00a0down.\u00a0", "She said the lockdown experience created a sense fear and traumatised the community.", "This led to an\u00a0increased lack of trust and confidence around vaccine information.\u00a0", "\"Even for myself, there was a lot of fear.\"", "Drawing on her language skills in Somali, Arabic and English, Ms\u00a0Salat has been working with several\u00a0organisations, including the\u00a0East African Women's Foundation,\u00a0Somali Community Inc. Australia, and\u00a0AMSAA Youth Connect.", "They have been bringing community leaders and doctors together to\u00a0conduct information sessions via Zoom and in local meetings to provide vaccine and COVID advice.\u00a0", "Since the sessions have been taking place, there has been a\u00a0big change in attitude towards vaccinations and rates have been increasing, Ms Salat said.\u00a0", "Ms Salat, who\u00a0has continued to coordinate donations during 2021's lockdowns, including arranging devices for remote schooling,\u00a0received\u00a0the Community Response and Recovery Award on Tuesday.", "\"Culturally and linguistically diverse communities representing Somalia, Eretria, Sudan, Ethiopia were greatly supported by Marwo\u2019s tireless efforts to coordinate the needs of affected residents,\"\u00a0the\u00a0Multicultural Commission said.", "Ms Salat says she continues to be inspired by her community, which has been coming together throughout the pandemic no matter where they are from.", "
Six lockdowns and\u00a0450,000 meals
", "After delivering more than 450,000 freshly-cooked meals\u00a0 \u2013 and counting \u2013 to people's doorsteps in Melbourne's south-east throughout the pandemic, Sikh Volunteers Australia received the Premier's Award for Community Harmony.", "Driving around with \"free food\" signs across the sides of vans, the organisation had originally supported bushfire affected communities in the East Gippsland Shire.", "But the operation was ramped up during the 2020 lockdown when \"heartbreaking\" messages started coming in daily\u00a0from members of the Sikh community in distress,\u00a0Sikh Volunteers Australia co-founder and secretary Jaswinder Singh told the ABC.", "", "
Sikh Volunteers Australia have been proving freshly-cooked vegetarian meals throughout all types of crises in Victoria and have plans to keep growing.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "Over the seven months of the lockdown, more than\u00a0over 100,000 free meals were delivered.", "The organisation purchased an Uber-style app to organise requests and currently covers 45 suburbs with the help of\u00a0around 300 volunteers\u00a0from all age groups and culturally diverse backgrounds.", "\"It's not an easy thing, especially such a large scale of operation, but there is kind of faith and the encouragement from the community that keeps us moving,\" Mr Singh said.\u00a0", "He said the pandemic has taught them about what's possible and now the organisation's sights are set on growing even bigger.\u00a0", "They are looking to set up commercial kitchen and will buy a fleet of vans so volunteers won't need to use their own vehicles.\u00a0", "A Facebook fundraiser earlier this year raised $600,000 in seven days, Mr\u00a0Singh said.\u00a0", "\"We have an idea that, God forbid, if disasters happen anywhere in the Victoria, we will be in position to cook and serve food for the affected community.\"", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
